result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven Francisco Cervantes-Camarena

defendant.name: Cervantes-Camarena, Steven Francisco
defendant.address: 404 S Neenah Ave, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on December 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:09 AM Defendant Steven Francisco Cervantes-Camarena appeared by video from the Door County Jail.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin. SPD still in process of finding counsel for defendant. Bond remains in effect.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Letter to court from defendant requesting bond modification. Will address on 10/31/22. DTE
Adjourned initial appearance on October 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:00 AM Defendant Steven Francisco Cervantes-Camarena appeared by video from the Door County Jail.  Attorney Aleksandra Hodowany in court for State of Wisconsin. Court indicates defendant qualifies for SPD, has not been appointed counsel yet. Bond remains in effect.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant appeared in court in custody.

1:11 PM  Defendant Steven Francisco Cervantes-Camarena appeared by video from the Door County Jail.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Carrie LaPlant appeared by video for Steven Cervantes-Camarena. Court reviews events in file, Questions defendant on absence from last hearing. Court quashes warrant. State requests previous bond set stay in effect.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:07 AM Defendant Steven Francisco Cervantes-Camarena not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file.  State requests statewide bench warrant.  Court grants requests, issues statewide bench warrant.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Pretrial Release Monitoring Program: Must be enrolled and equipment activated prior to release. Drug Monitoring.   Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then take only in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.

1:00 PM  Defendant Steven Francisco Cervantes-Camarena appeared by video from the Door County Jail.  Attorney Amanda Toonen in court for Steven Francisco Cervantes-Camarena.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin.  Atty Toonen indicates she will be representing defendant for todays hearing, advises SPD will be appointing counsel to represent defendant.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim.  Atty Toonen requests balance of IA be set to allow SPD time to appoint counsel.  Court questions defendant on address/employment.  Bond set.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
